message: Added a custom_rules.xml that will a) include the version in the APK filename b) create an assets/build.properties file that contains compile time options (given to ant via commandline properties). The default is now to build an APK for sideloading. The playstore.txt file is now retired.

title: sitDown() -> reVist(), also reset the counters.
message: sitDown() -> reVist(), also reset the counters.

title: On Android, Preferences must be flushed before an updated value can be read.…
message: On Android, Preferences must be flushed before an updated value can be read. Since we now only flush on pause/exit, the Player objects need to be reused. Positive side effects: less memory allocation.

title: The engine now manages a global preferences instance.
message: The engine now manages a global preferences instance.

title: Added 'directFLush' flag to MuteManager and TrialUtil. Then found out that…
message: Added 'directFLush' flag to MuteManager and TrialUtil. Then found out that Gdx.app.getPreferences() returns a new object on every call and that settings were not stored in the object that got flushed in pause() and dispose(). Finally added BureauGame.bootGame() so a preferences object could be created that is valid for the whole app life cycle.

message: BUGFIX: don't stop() music in dispose

message: BUGFIX: dispose the current screen if the game is disposed.

message: Better performance.

title: Simplified the usage of the fade over screen.
message: Simplified the usage of the fade over screen.

title: A lot of cleanup and streamlining. Preferences are now handled from the main…
message: A lot of cleanup and streamlining. Preferences are now handled from the main game class and flushed only when the game is paused or destroyed. The old variation loader code had to be completely rewritten for this and as a side effect, the FadeOverScreen is now a reuseable instance. All the user should notice of this is some speed up on slower devices because we write less to the persistant storage.

message: Flush preferences only when exiting the screen.
